duplication-detector.name: Duplication Detector
duplication-detector.description: Finds duplicate code, classes, and enums across the project. Essential for refactoring requests, code cleanup, and maintaining code quality. Use when user asks about duplicate code, similar functions, refactoring opportunities, or code organization.
impactScenarios: User wants to refactor duplicate code
User asks to clean up similar functions
User mentions code repetition or redundancy
User wants to improve code organization

tree-navigator.name: Tree Navigator
tree-navigator.description: Analyzes project structure, dependencies, and circular references. Critical for understanding code architecture, navigation, and dependency issues. Use when user asks about project structure, imports, dependencies, or architectural questions.
impactScenarios: User wants to understand project architecture
User asks about dependencies between files
User mentions circular dependency issues
User needs help navigating large codebase

context-optimizer.name: Context Optimizer
context-optimizer.description: Optimizes context for Claude interactions by selecting the most relevant files and code sections. Always useful for reducing token usage and improving response quality. Use for almost every request to provide focused, relevant context.
impactScenarios: Any request that needs focused code context
Large codebase queries that might hit token limits
User asks for specific code analysis or modification
General code understanding or explanation requests

vector-search.name: Vector Search & RAG
vector-search.description: Semantic code search and similarity analysis using vector embeddings. Essential for finding related code, similar patterns, and retrieving relevant context based on meaning rather than keywords.
impactScenarios: User asks to find similar code patterns
User wants examples of how something is implemented
User searches for specific functionality semantically
User needs to understand code relationships

issues-detector.name: Issues Detector
issues-detector.description: Comprehensive Claude Code issue detection including scope problems, topology issues, and quality assessment. Use when user reports bugs, asks for code review, or wants quality improvement.
impactScenarios: User reports bugs or errors in code
User asks for code review or quality assessment
User wants to improve code quality
User mentions performance or reliability issues

knowledge-graph.name: Semantic Knowledge Graph
knowledge-graph.description: Builds semantic understanding of codebase relationships and entities. Provides deep architectural insights and pattern detection. Use for complex architectural questions and relationship understanding.
impactScenarios: User asks about architectural relationships
User wants to understand complex code interactions
User needs insights about code patterns
User asks about semantic meaning of code structure

centralization-detector.name: Centralization Detector
centralization-detector.description: Detects scattered configuration and centralization opportunities. Critical for config management, environment setup, and code organization. Use when user asks about configuration, environment variables, or code consolidation.
impactScenarios: User asks about configuration management
User wants to centralize scattered config values
User mentions environment setup issues
User wants to organize configuration files

code-docs-reconciler.name: Code-Documentation Reconciler
code-docs-reconciler.description: Bidirectional synchronization between code implementation and documentation. Essential for documentation updates, API spec validation, and ensuring code-docs alignment.
impactScenarios: User asks about updating documentation
User wants to sync code with API specifications
User mentions documentation is out of date
User needs to generate documentation from code

workflow-orchestrator.name: Workflow Orchestrator
workflow-orchestrator.description: Orchestrates multiple tools in intelligent workflows for complex, multi-step analysis. Use for comprehensive requests that benefit from combining multiple tools in sequence or parallel.
impactScenarios: User asks for comprehensive code analysis
User wants production readiness check
User requests multi-faceted code review
User asks for complete project assessment

newFeature.description: User wants to implement new functionality

bugFix.description: User reports bugs or needs fixes

codeReview.description: User wants code review or quality assessment

refactoring.description: User wants to refactor or reorganize code

documentation.description: User wants to update or create documentation

architecture.description: User asks about project architecture or design

comprehensive.description: User requests thorough analysis or production readiness
